name: BOEING HELICOPTER COMPANY, Appellant, v. WORKMEN'S COMPENSATION APPEAL BOARD and Joseph L. McCanney
name_abbreviation: Boeing Helicopter Co. v. Workmen's Compensation Appeal Board

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS, CAPPY, CASTILLE and MONTEMURO, JJ.
MONTEMURO, J., is sitting by designation.
parties: BOEING HELICOPTER COMPANY, Appellant, v. WORKMEN’S COMPENSATION APPEAL BOARD and Joseph L. McCanney.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
MONTEMURO, J., is sitting by designation.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Clifford A. Goldstein, Philadelphia, for Boeing.
J. Lawson Johnston, Pittsburgh, for amicus-Pa. Mfrs. Ass’n. Thomas E. Timby, Newtown, for J. McCanney.
Norman R. Haigh, Secretary, for W.C.A.B.
Marilyn T. Jamain, Philadelphia, for amicus-U.A.W.
Marc S. Jacobs, Philadelphia, for amicus-AEL-CIO.
casebody.head_matter:
652 A.2d 796
BOEING HELICOPTER COMPANY, Appellant, v. WORKMEN’S COMPENSATION APPEAL BOARD and Joseph L. McCanney.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Dec. 5, 1994.
Decided Dec. 30, 1994.
Clifford A. Goldstein, Philadelphia, for Boeing.
J. Lawson Johnston, Pittsburgh, for amicus-Pa. Mfrs. Ass’n. Thomas E. Timby, Newtown, for J. McCanney.
Norman R. Haigh, Secretary, for W.C.A.B.
Marilyn T. Jamain, Philadelphia, for amicus-U.A.W.
Marc S. Jacobs, Philadelphia, for amicus-AEL-CIO.
Before NIX, C.J., and FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS, CAPPY, CASTILLE and MONTEMURO, JJ.
